Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.@Core.Description: Terms to describe which data in a given entity model can be aggregated, and how.

ApplySupported.@Core.Description: This entity set or collection supports the `$apply` system query option

ApplySupportedDefaults.@Core.Description: Default support of the `$apply` system query option for all collection-valued resources in the container
ApplySupportedDefaults.@Core.LongDescription:
Annotating term [`ApplySupported`](#ApplySupported) for a specific collection-valued resource overrides the default support with the specified properties using PATCH semantics:

- Primitive or collection-valued properties specified in `ApplySupported` replace the corresponding properties specified in `ApplySupportedDefaults`

- Complex-valued properties specified in `ApplySupported` override the corresponding properties specified in `ApplySupportedDefaults` using PATCH semantics recursively

- Properties specified neither in `ApplySupported` nor in `ApplySupportedDefaults` have their default value

Transformations.@Core.Description: Transformations that can be used in `$apply`

CustomAggregationMethods.@Core.Description: Qualified names of custom aggregation methods that can be used in `aggregate(...with...)`

Rollup.@Core.Description: The service supports rollup hierarchies in a `groupby` transformation

From.@Core.Description: The service supports the `from` keyword in an `aggregate` transformation

PropertyRestrictions.@Core.Description: Only properties marked as `Groupable` can be used in the `groupby` transformation, and only those marked as `Aggregatable` can be used in the  `aggregate` transformation

GroupableProperties.@Core.Description: A non-empty collection indicates that only the listed properties of the annotated target are supported by the `groupby` transformation

AggregatableProperties.@Core.Description: A non-empty collection indicates that only the listed properties of the annotated target can be used in the `aggregate` transformation, optionally restricted to the specified aggregation methods

SupportedAggregationMethods.@Core.Description: Standard and custom aggregation methods than can be applied to the property. If omitted, all aggregation methods can be applied

RecommendedAggregationMethod.@Core.Description: Recommended method for aggregating values of the property

RollupType.@Core.Description: The number of `rollup` or `rolluprecursive` or `traverserecursive` operators allowed in a `groupby` transformation
RollupType.SingleHierarchy@Core.Description: Only one `rollup` or `rolluprecursive` or `traverserecursive` operator per `groupby`

Groupable.@Core.Description: This property can be used in the `groupby` transformation

Aggregatable.@Core.Description: This property can be used in the `aggregate` transformation

CustomAggregate.@Core.Description: Dynamic property that can be used in the `aggregate` transformation
CustomAggregate.@Core.LongDescription: This term MUST be applied with a Qualifier, the Qualifier value is the name of the dynamic property. The value of the annotation MUST be the qualified name of a primitive type. The aggregated value will be of that type.

ContextDefiningProperties.@Core.Description: The annotated property or custom aggregate is only well-defined in the context of these properties
ContextDefiningProperties.@Core.LongDescription: The context-defining properties need either be part of the result entities, or be restricted to a single value by a pre-filter operation. Examples are postal codes within a country, or monetary amounts whose context is the unit of currency.

LeveledHierarchy.@Core.Description: Defines a leveled hierarchy by defining an ordered list of properties in the hierarchy

NodeProperty.@Core.Description: Primitive property holding the hierarchy node identifier

ParentNavigationProperty.@Core.Description: Property for navigating to the parent node. Its type MUST be the entity type annotated with this term, and it MUST be single-valued and nullable.

HierarchyQualifier.@Core.LongDescription:
Every recursive hierarchy function defined in this vocabulary has
- a parameter `HierarchyQualifier` of this type and
- a parameter `HierarchyNodes` that is a collection of entities of a common type without multiple occurrences of the same entity.

`HierarchyQualifier` is the qualifier of a `RecursiveHierarchy` annotation on the entity type of the collection
given by the `HierarchyNodes` parameter. This specifies a recursive hierarchy that is evaluated by the function.

isroot.@Core.Description: Is the node a root of the hierarchy specified by the [parameter pair](#HierarchyQualifier) (`HierarchyNodes`, `HierarchyQualifier`)?
isroot.@Core.LongDescription: If a node identifier passed to the function is null, the function returns null.

$Parameter.@Core.Description: A collection, given through a `$root` expression
Node identifier of the putative root

isdescendant.@Core.Description: Is the node a descendant of the ancestor node in the hierarchy specified by the [parameter pair](#HierarchyQualifier) (`HierarchyNodes`, `HierarchyQualifier`) with at most the specified distance?
isdescendant.@Core.LongDescription: If a node identifier passed to the function is null, the function returns null.

$Parameter.@Core.Description: A collection, given through a `$root` expression
Node identifier of the putative descendant
Node identifier of the ancestor node
Whether the node is considered a descendant of itself

isancestor.@Core.Description: Is the node an ancestor of the descendant node in the hierarchy specified by the [parameter pair](#HierarchyQualifier) (`HierarchyNodes`, `HierarchyQualifier`) with at most the specified distance?
isancestor.@Core.LongDescription: If a node identifier passed to the function is null, the function returns null.

$Parameter.@Core.Description: A collection, given through a `$root` expression
Node identifier of the putative ancestor
Node identifier of the descendant node
Whether the node is considered an ancestor of itself

issibling.@Core.Description: Returns true if the node has the same parent as the other node in the hierarchy specified by the [parameter pair](#HierarchyQualifier) (`HierarchyNodes`, `HierarchyQualifier`) or both are roots
issibling.@Core.LongDescription: A node is not a sibling of itself. If a node identifier passed to the function is null, the function returns null.

$Parameter.@Core.Description: A collection, given through a `$root` expression
Node identifier of the putative sibling
Node identifier of the other node

isleaf.@Core.Description: Is the node a leaf in the hierarchy specified by the [parameter pair](#HierarchyQualifier) (`HierarchyNodes`, `HierarchyQualifier`)?
isleaf.@Core.LongDescription: If a node identifier passed to the function is null, the function returns null.

$Parameter.@Core.Description: A collection, given through a `$root` expression
Node identifier of the putative leaf

excludingdescendants.@Core.Description: During `rolluprecursive` for a hierarchy node, this function marks instances that are related to the node itself rather than a descendant
excludingdescendants.@Core.LongDescription:
This function may only occur in the second parameter of a `groupby` transformation whose first parameter
          contains `rolluprecursive(...)`. It is evaluated as part of the transformation `R(x)` in the "`rolluprecursive` algorithm"
          [OData-Aggr, section 3.5.3]. Its behavior is undefined outside of this algorithm.

          `groupby((rolluprecursive(...)), filter(Aggregation.excludingdescendants())/aggregate(...))` constructs a rollup
          that contains aggregates per hierarchy node while excluding descendants from the aggregation.

$Parameter.@Core.Description: Position N among the `rolluprecursive` operators in the first argument of `groupby`
$Parameter.@Core.LongDescription:
Every instance in the output set of a `groupby` transformation with M `rolluprecursive` operators
            has M relationships to M nodes in M recursive hierarchies. This function returns true if relationship number N
            relates the instance given in the binding parameter to the node itself rather than a descendant.

AvailableOnAggregates.@Core.Description: This action or function is available on aggregated entities if the `RequiredProperties` are still defined

RequiredProperties.@Core.Description: Properties required to apply this action or function

@Core.Revisions.Description: [`Capabilities.NavigationRestrictions`](Org.OData.Capabilities.V1.md#NavigationRestrictions) that make use of the additional properties in this subtype are deprecated in favor of [`ApplySupported`](#ApplySupported) and [`CustomAggregate`](#CustomAggregate)

NavigationPropertyAggregationCapabilitie.@Core.Description: Aggregation capabilities on a navigation path

Name.@Core.Description: Name of the dynamic property that can be used in the `aggregate` transformation

Type.@Core.Description: Qualified name of a primitive type. The aggregated value will be of that type
